column5: Do it!!!
I have no idea how I‚Äôd get the $ but yeah.  Sounds outstanding.
Never wanted anything more.
She crawls into bed w/ red Crocks w/ little hearts all over them, pulls the covers up and talks to Alexa while ‚ÄúWhatever Gets You Through The Night‚Äù plays.
This is the perfect question.  Yes!
This.  Perfect description.  Narcissism and impulse control disorders run amok.

No.  Someone with OCD is LESS likely to harm someone; people with MI in general are LESS dangerous, unless they have command hallucinations (hearing voices that tell you to do X).  His self dx sounds correct.  Why does he have to wait until Fall for help, though?  I‚Äôd encourage him finding a therapist before then.  Your college isn‚Äôt going to have a therapist skilled in OCD treatment, which is exposure-response therapy; it‚Äôll be a few free meetings where he‚Äôs referred to a therapist anyway.  When I first entered treatment for OCD, I was also in college with no money, but there are places that will see you on a reduced fee schedule.  I used to get samples of medications from a psychiatrist who charged me $10 per visit.  Being stuck in your head like that is fairly hellacious, I feel for you guys.  If he does not have OCD, there‚Äôs some real bad anxiety going on.  He can go to a medical MD for a blood test to make sure there‚Äôs nothing medical (stuff like vitamin b-12 deficiency, thyroid problems, inflammation, and sleep apnea can cause severe anxiety and other problems; best to rule that stuff out first).  Then the med MD can treat medical stuff if that‚Äôs going on, some will try an SSRI, some will refer out, depends on the MD and what‚Äôs going on.

Now I understand why my #1 rule for myself is to accept whatever I am into or feeling as ok, fine, or good, but not bad or wrong or shameful.  8 billion people on the planet, extrapolate that, someone is into what you‚Äôre into and feeling what you‚Äôre feeling.  That thought calms me, somehow.  But I no longer beat myself up about everything-every thought used to be filtered through my abusers/parents in my head.  Shame used to prevail everything I did and thought because my parents taught me to be ashamed of everything about myself, even my future self.  Weight, looks, grades, friends - nothing was off limits for ridicule.  Gross.  Took a lot of therapy and it took forever for me to understand that it is ok for me to have self esteem (I thought I didn‚Äôt deserve it, questioned how one earns that right).  I don‚Äôt need emotional armor around narcissistic soul suckers anymore, just the self esteem to walk away from their crazy, to leave the other end of the rope on the floor.  Life is hard, walk away from the narc, do not engage.  Keep yourself safe.
You can also refuse to pick up the rope in the first place if someone tosses you one.  Piss on that rope!  Walk away, indeed!  Freeing.
If we could make people stop voting for people who don‚Äôt believe in science and education...

If it doesn‚Äôt matter, and it doesn‚Äôt (trust, I‚Äôve spent time here in these thoughts), then your friends are real, you‚Äôre not in The Truman Show, and your people have real feelings.  There‚Äôs no way to tell if we‚Äôre in a simulation and it also doesn‚Äôt matter.  Real.  People are real for your thought purposes.  Otherwise, you‚Äôre doing damage telling others you don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre real, because anything they tell you doesn‚Äôt matter, nothing about them matters.  That‚Äôs a shitty thing to be told, by anyone.  That‚Äôs the thing I never used to take into account about my OCD, was how it affects others.  It can make you almost delusional with its twisty ways!  But I do know that your friends are real, with real feelings and needs from you that you may be ignoring due to OCD brain hijack.  Just remember: OCD thoughts lie to you.
Wait, is it?!

I watched a thing with Brene Brown and Russell Brand a while ago and she‚Äôs so good.  I went on a date not long ago where I drove 1.5 hours to meet this guy from online and met him for dinner, and I just spewed a bunch of stuff right away - with a 1.5 hour drive, there‚Äôs a lot that can filter through your head.  He cut it short, like abrupt weird and said, no, this isn‚Äôt what I‚Äôm looking for.  I was kind of shaken for a minute.  In my car on the way back, I knew it was because I‚Äôd just diarrhea‚Äôd the things that had happened in the past few months, as I‚Äôd gone through a sea change in my life.  But you don‚Äôt dump that on a stranger, lol.  I knew better than that, I just hadn‚Äôt dated in over 20 years.  Disconnection, distrust, and disengagement.  Yep.  Causes that.  Wait to know the person first.  As a stay home mom, sometimes just adult convo is nice and I don‚Äôt get enough of it, so I have to watch myself for over sharing.

I agree.  Takes time though, I‚Äôm 43 and just figuring this shit out.  My parents were abusive bullies so it‚Äôs been a lifetime of struggle because all of my friends were also bullies.  Didn‚Äôt realize that until I was in my 20‚Äôs, patterns are hard to spot in ourselves.  I‚Äôve stopped masking-hadn‚Äôt even heard the term before 5 years ago-almost all the way.  Things are 100% better.  I will not hide for anyone anymore.  8 billion people in the world-there are a few who like me exactly as I am, and I can spot a harmful person from a mile away now.  It‚Äôs a good skill to hone, but you have to meet and interact with kind of a lot of people to do it.  I was really like a bully magnet in my 20‚Äôs so it‚Äôs interesting to choose safe good people now and have confidence in myself to do it.  I just got tired of being bullied and not being myself, and I had to get really angry to change.

That is generally how it works; you have to see your GP and then they refer you to a sleep specialist.  If you want a diagnosis, you have to see a sleep MD.  If your sleep is off by several hours, they‚Äôre going to try to find something else wrong so they can pretend they‚Äôre giving you treatment.  Like I wear a CPAP for the least treatable amount of apnea, and have lost 40 lbs, so I don‚Äôt really need the mask - but you can be sure it‚Äôs only thing they talk about at my MD appts, so they feel like they can pat themselves on the back for treating something.  DSPD talk is, ‚Äúwell, no one else is going to change your sleep patterns but you.‚Äù  Ha, and another ha.  Your experience will differ for sure, and there is someone on this sub who has a sleep MD with DSPD (lucky!), but I think that expecting any kind of quick fix would be met with sadness.  Read as much as you can about it before you go to the MD and bring a sleep log with you, start now just writing down when you sleep, how long you lay in bed, how much sleep you get, and how you feel the next day.  Good luck!

I‚Äôm blown away right now.  My belly is a mess, always has been.  Eat weird hours, sleep weird hours, have problems with digestion to a weird degree, even after treatment.  Just had gallbladder and uterus removed due in part to digestive belly issues.  Sleep has been extra weird lately.  Thank you for this.

Weird as hell.  Had surgery a few weeks ago and also have been tapering off my Lexapro, down to 10 mg. as am really ok in my life now after therapy for loads of years.  Have a fitbit and for the past 2 weeks, the weirdest patterns have emerged, the most alarming that every other night, I sleep about 8 hours, and the alternate nights I sleep about 12 hours.  I think that on 8 hour nights I'm doing way too much for someone in recovery from major surgery and then I need to sleep 12 hours the next day to recover.  I'm trying to stop being impulsive and to relax, but weird Covid anxiety and lack of schedule are making things hard.  I'm sleeping any where from 12-5 am to 8-3pm.  It's bizarre.  Headed to bed in a few minutes, it's 7 am.  I'll be up by 3 today.  I'm just letting my body do what it wants but I so much wish I could control my sleep to any degree right now.  Seems futile and like something to just accept right now, so I'm trying.  May serenity find you all!
Aren't we all retarded geniuses in the end?

Me, too.  It's the literal worst.  Can't do shit to save my life, even on meds, there's no having a schedule.  Even without depression and anxiety, there's no having a schedule.  I write it down, in painful detail, to the minute sometimes, but never actually follow it.  Stuff gets done in random fashion, so I can't depend on my brain to do anything.  I have a few tasks to do that I've put off for months that have literally horrible consequences but that are so easy they'd have taken less than a day total to do before quarantine.  Now, nothing is open and I can't take care of this stuff, and the bills are coming due.  It feels idiotic to not be able to write something down and follow it.  Like am I self-sabataging, I don't think so, because I just can not follow a schedule.  I've been fascinated with people who do since forever.  I keep a to do list, but 90% of it lately just gets deferred to the next day.  Frustrating, I feel ya.
Imagine this has happened countless times to people lately due to Covid.  The worst timeline, we do live in.

I read one chapter and had to put it down when Covid hit.  I know it‚Äôs going to take a while to get through but that it will be worth it.  I hate that the recovery process is literally the rest of your damned life.  20 years dealing and just now finding peace.
Love this!  Thank you.
Like the Joker: people expecting you to act like you don‚Äôt have a mental illness, when in fact, you do.  Makes it easier on NT‚Äôs to expect everyone to act the same regardless of ability.
Laughed pretty hard the whole way through, great job!
In The Very Worst Timeline...

Yeah.  I have in the past; I call it hibernating.  Unbearable to do much.  It‚Äôs ok if it‚Äôs like a few hours or a day, but now if it‚Äôs any longer I know that staying in that mode is more harmful than any comfort I feel.  Leads to isolation and depression if it goes very long, and pretty quick for me.  But for sure, I need to just clock out of all life for a few hours or a day or two every once in a while.  The further into recovery I get the less I do this.  Corona threatens me daily with wanting to hibernate, but I rage against the dying of my light and do things and talk to people and exercise and eat right.  But that bed, maaaaan!  Sometimes she‚Äôs the best thing on the planet.

This is really a question for your psych doc, because all of the answers here are going to be anecdotal and body chemistry, circumstances, etc. are vastly different for everyone.  My experience with clonazepam: I have depression and anxiety, ADHD, and a sleep disorder that requires ADHD meds.  So I take Lexapro 20 mg, Clonazepam .5mg, Adderall 10 mg BID, and NAC (N_acetyl cycstine-completely gets rid of cuticle biting and endless repetitive songs, so I count it as important as a prescription even tho it is OTC - 1000 mg BID).  I‚Äôve been through therapy twice for a total of nine years now, and I have gotten rid of some of the chronic pain that I had by having 2 surgeries within the past 6 months.  I think I had a TON of inflammation that was causing depression.  I don‚Äôt have any anxiety whatsoever now, which is nuts - but I also did a lot of work on myself and my behaviors and thoughts to get here.  That‚Äôs the key.  A pill can help you so much.  Anyway, I was prescribed clonazepam a long time ago, to counter really horrible anxiety the SSRI didn‚Äôt get rid of - and it worked, for a while.  Until I couldn‚Äôt really tell what it was doing anymore.  When I was prescribed Ritalin like 2 years ago, I needed to take more Clonazepam to stop the anxiety from that, but then I tried Adderall, and at 10 mg it doesn‚Äôt give the creepy feeling Ritalin did.  I mean, if you take .5 mg Clon. for like 10 years, not sure what it does, because now I basically use it for sleep.  If I don‚Äôt take it at night, not sleeping more than like a nap length.  I‚Äôm not sure what degree I need it for my mental health vs. avoiding with withdrawal effects.  I‚Äôm tapering off my Lexapro, with my doctor and therapist‚Äôs ok.  I‚Äôm doing ok coming off of it, am doing a quarter pill reduction every 2 weeks.  Slow is the key.  I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll be able to taper off the clon as fast, but I do intend to try to taper.  I don‚Äôt know what to think about clonazepam; I‚Äôve thought of it as a necessary evil forever.  I know that during panic attacks, it was a lifesaver, and I will probably always just carry an ‚Äúin case‚Äù tablet with me, but I probably will never need it.  It‚Äôs one of those things that if you NEED it, definitely take it.  But I don‚Äôt know if given the script today if I‚Äôd take it every day, mainly because I know the sleeplessness that will happen when I stop taking it.  I also think it‚Äôs made me a bit numb to things.  Up in the air as to whether that‚Äôs more the Lexapro or the Clon, but we will see.  It‚Äôs very possible it‚Äôs been messing with my sleep and other stuff that had a negative impact on me as a while, who knows.  I intend to find out.
Thisüëç

Yeah.  I was a doormat forever and now when I put up boundaries and healthy shit, I feel like an asshole.  I‚Äôd rather be a healthy mean girl than a doormat, tho, any day of the week.  I think it just takes practice.
Whaaaaaaaat?!
Malignant narcissist, a special kind of sadist.
Lot of guys go soft real quick after.

I have both ADHD and a sleep disorder called DSPD, where my circadian rhythm is off.  Can‚Äôt sleep until really late, like 4am - 6 am, even when I was in grade school it was after midnight, usually 2 am.  I‚Äôm 43 now.  It‚Äôs a big deal.  If you can‚Äôt get your sleep on track by yourself, see a sleep doctor.  Sleep apnea can also keep you awake and produce symptoms that look like ADHD.
This made me snorty laugh.  I feel you.

Yep, I feel this.  Time.  I‚Äôve often said I‚Äôm not a one time person; meaning, if you meet me once, you‚Äôll have no idea who I am.  It takes a long time for me to warm up enough to come out and be myself.  Some people are guarded and will need more reassurance you‚Äôre real and a bit invested before they can be themselves.  It‚Äôs ok, there are shades of grey with dating, even when you‚Äôre older. I have spent a few months getting to know someone who holds his cards very close to his chest and find it rewarding to be let in, albeit slowly.
Watched that 10 times, crying laughing, thank you!

Zero point.  I don‚Äôt believe in marriage anymore, after 20 years in one, though.  But yeah, weddings are just ridiculous.  They‚Äôve been commodified so hardcore completely.  I hated my wedding because I hate people looking at me and being the center of attention.  Woke up in a panic, cried, dissociated, then had that happen a few more cycles through the day.  Felt lonely and sad, even with all of the people around.  Got drunk and I had a marginally better time, but man.  The things that go into planning and the anxiety of the day and the money.  NO WAY!  Just elope, like my grandma told me to do.   Go to somewhere you‚Äôd honeymoon and do the wedding quick, with no attendees, lol.  Seriously the only way I‚Äôd do it again.  I‚Äôm also realizing my sexual tastes might be a bit more open and poly than I‚Äôve allowed myself to admit.  Don‚Äôt think a committed relationship would be right if I want to honor my sexuality, which I‚Äôm tired of denying (sexual masking?  is that a thing?) and want to honor now.
Takes something to give me goosebumps

There are a lot of people at the top who do not belong there.  There are an insane amount of people at the top with narcissism and power and control issues.  If someone tells you that you are ‚Äúnot like‚Äù a certain group, or to stop talking with certain people, they think of themselves and you as better than others.  Brazen!  They usually live at the top of the food chain with their manipulative ability to make you think they know things you don‚Äôt or that they have their pulse on the key to life.  Yeah, they don‚Äôt.  I think I used to get bullied because I didn‚Äôt understand boundaries, personal boundaries.  I grew up in a chaotic neglectful house, and I had to fend for myself a lot plus the added bonus of getting bullied by my parents.  They didn‚Äôt like or understand that I think and do things differently, and certainly did not teach me boundaries.  It took a while in therapy for me to effectively learn about and use boundaries, but I will say that I think it‚Äôs the only way to stay sane long term.  I got so tired of being a doormat and not feeling like I had any power at all that I had to change.  Boundaries restore your power and allow you to protect yourself from bullying.
You mean the nice, normal face of the psychopath?  That‚Äôs how they get to be in important positions.  Manipulation of the highest order.
This is excellent advice.

There could be a lot of things going on, but what I notice about your post is the way you‚Äôve titled it - instructive as to how you feel about yourself.   Your loved ones will likely understand if you just tell them what‚Äôs going on, that you feel rage immediately when things frustrate you, and you aren‚Äôt sure how to deal with it yet.  Tell them to give you space.  But in the meantime, you HAVE to work on your rage.  So get another therapist who understands all the facets of what you‚Äôre dealing with and get diagnosed so you can get proper help.  I‚Äôve had a lifetime of depression and anxiety and ADD.  The thing that leads to rage immediately is my ADD because it controls executive function, and that‚Äôs the thing that will piss you off because it feels like you should be able to do these things but your brain isn‚Äôt set up like other people‚Äôs.  Coupled with the trauma, it feels like failure.  I‚Äôve been there.  Proper diagnosis is key.

About 5 years ago, this show came out called Mr Robot.  I‚Äôd never heard the term masking at that point.  After watching the show obsessively (it became my special interest) for 4 years, it wasn‚Äôt until the last season about 6 mo ago that I realized what the main character was doing when he masked, how it effected/affected himself and everyone around him.  I then realized that I use a mask constantly, always.  People I‚Äôve known my entire life don‚Äôt actually know me.  I‚Äôm trying to remedy this and say everything out loud.  Even when I feel like panicking because someone is gonna know the thing...still better to let them know than to pick up the mask again.  My motto now is that there are 8 billion people in the world and there have to be people who like me exactly as I am.  I‚Äôve always been the quirky weird girl people kind of half ass listen to.  Now that I‚Äôve disclosed stuff to people who care, I feel realer, somehow.  Like I can just ground myself and be ok and other people don‚Äôt make me panic and anxious all the time anymore.  I don‚Äôt have to figure out how to act around everyone, I just do what I do without worry.  It‚Äôs freeing.
Malice is too nice, sadism fits here.
NO IT DOESN‚ÄôT!
That‚Äôs my question, also.

Me, too!  I‚Äôm waiting to do a full rewatch for a minute so I forget stuff and it blows me away again.  Have seen 1-3 a million times but only saw season 4 twice.  Can‚Äôt wait for that whole rewatch!
Watch Mr. Robot, I implore you!  Deals with abuse on another level, and is the best show I‚Äôve ever seen, period, because of this.

And when they said all that, I said, I now get how fascism happened.  It had seemed impossible up until that very point, that happening here in the USA, but when they said all that, I saw the future as a fiery train crash.
You got it.  F this noise.
One slap per pissed American.  That‚Äôs my favorite way to picture McConnell.

I mean, just give it time, right?  Not sure why I‚Äôm commenting on a 2 day old post, but man, I swear in a few weeks, there will be enough people with it that even the weirdos who can‚Äôt understand that it‚Äôs real will be impacted by someone who has it or tangentially knows someone who has it.  What a sad time.
Constant.  Tell them to F off and leave your feelings out of their life.
Could also be too low, sounds like when it wears off is the panic?  Need longer lasting or to take another dose, because ‚Äúwhere do I start?‚Äù sounds like ADHD.
I‚Äôm so sorry.  Wtf, people.  Wtf is the world coming to?

Brain in bed that night: repeats snippets of conversation that were normal to everyone else, tormenting me and asking me if there‚Äôs any way possible people still like me...brain obvs wants me  to conclude people hate me.  Actively have to work against this all the time, weird inferiority thing where I don‚Äôt feel like I have the right to breathe air.
*Did not approve.

Yeah.  I come back to my lonely cereal and waiting for the bus in kindergarten a lot.  I used to laser like stare at the oven clock so I‚Äôd know when to go outside.  I get flashes of that clock and pouring cereal by myself pretty frequently.  Hurts.  Realize the neglect was pretty much right away, I mean you‚Äôre like 5 in kindergarten.  One day I missed the bus and walked to school by myself, which wasn‚Äôt far but why would my parents ask a 5 year old to figure out what to do in the event they miss the bus?  I remember getting to school and being so shaken up by having missed the bus and having to walk that I was beside myself-like even now I remember it being one of those times I felt helpless because I was so shy I wouldn‚Äôt have ever been able to verbally explain why I was shaken.  I just felt scared because I‚Äôd been told not to walk by myself but I also knew I couldn‚Äôt miss school or I‚Äôd get killed.  I remember wanting to be parented really bad, like I needed someone to be like, ‚ÄúOH!  You missed the bus?  Well how terrible!  And you had to walk?  OMG.  Well, if that ever happens again, call _____.  Or a parental, ‚ÄúSORRY I LEFT YOU AS A 5 YEAR OLD TO FEND FOR YOURSELF ALL THE TIME.‚Äù  Fuck.  Man.

There‚Äôs a clock in every one of your cells, and it‚Äôs off by a huge margin from everyone else.  That‚Äôs it.  No cure. Your body is different, you will be awake late into the night.  If you feel like you wanna die right now, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre just realizing what huge pain in the ass this thing is.  Yeah.  Accept that you can probably not change anything much.  Design your life to accommodate your sleep hours.  It‚Äôll make your life waaaaaay easier. I‚Äôm 43 - wish I‚Äôd gone into a career with a second shift.  Tell people to F off, that your sleep is completely the same as theirs just it‚Äôs imperative it happens at A DIFFERENT TIME!  That‚Äôs it.    Get a sleep test first and talk to a sleep MD, so you have medical evidence on your side for the ignorant people who are going to continually challenge you on this.  But yeah, if you get diagnosed, welcome to the club:  you must accept what you cannot change -  and that includes DSPD.  Accept that there will be people you care for dearly who will never understand.  Some of your doctors may not believe you!  My GP when I first got diagnosed in 2006 said, ‚Äúyou should go to bed at 9 pm.‚Äù  If you have DSPD, you know the rage I feel when recalling that.  Arm yourself with knowledge.  I like to tell people what makes sense for me is that an ancestor or two must‚Äôve had to stay up all night to look out for danger to protect themselves or their family, and that sleep pattern imprinted genetically on down to me.  It doesn‚Äôt serve a purpose in our modern world, but the way things are changing right now and people being able to work from home, I see hope for more flexible schedules for us DSPDers.  This is a disorder where it‚Äôs not even a damned disorder, if you ask me, it‚Äôs everyone else‚Äôs experience/opinion of when you SHOULD sleep that is the problem, and I don‚Äôt know about you, but I‚Äôm real tired of trying to tie myself into a pretzel to please everyone else but me. So I sleep when I need to and it makes me happy.  Took me a very, very long time to accept.  I‚Äôm happy now, though.

Get into a pattern of saying no more often to people, and shut off your phone or put it down.  I promise you, it is ok to not talk to a person for 1 day.  They can wait.  Especially that crap with sitting on a video chat watching people breathe?  NO!  You can‚Äôt do that.  You‚Äôre drained already.  For real recharge your batteries.  Use your time as your own and don‚Äôt give so much away.  It‚Äôs a valuable commodity.  It sucks walling yourself off from everyone, so you don‚Äôt want to isolate, but you do not have to feel like you must correspond to everyone else‚Äôs whims.  If you don‚Äôt put up boundaries, people will run over you.

I think that yes, might be stunting your growth a bit if you‚Äôre isolating that hardcore.  I just realized a few months ago how much I mask my true self and I was also staying home a ton.  I started to go out and meet people while being myself for real, with the attitude of ‚Äúif they don‚Äôt like me, there are 8 billion other people in the world, who cares?!‚Äù  and I started going to the gym after a 20 year hiatus.  I was feeling better: no depression or anxiety, and I never thought rhat would happen.  Now that I‚Äôm forced to be home, I recognize how much good getting out of the house did me.  A lot.  Exercise, too.  I‚Äôm starting to enter a new depression.  I just got out of a lifetime of it, and I can feel it creeping in.  It could be that we‚Äôre in a pandemic and I need to chill but stupid ass anxiety!
I‚Äôm with you.  The second we can we should all be in the damned streets.  Enough.  Way more of us than them.  Band together.
Yes, people can carry it and pass it without symptoms.

Ohhh, jeez, Drake!  I love him.  Tell him his little self is perfect!  I used to have a weenie who had IVDD surgery at 7 months old, his whole joint was shattered, little guy never did walk right, kinda hippity-hopped around.  He was barrel chested and a total lover, and he hated being alone, ever.  Would whine like he was dying if you didn‚Äôt let him snuggle you at all times, lol.  Miss him.

Yep, some sort of media mish mash of things.  Not sure I even like my thoughts on this because I have no skill in developing what I want to do.  I‚Äôve never seen what I want to do done, so I don‚Äôt know where to begin.

I‚Äôve tried all of the stimulants and non stimulants because I have ADHD and anxiety and a sleep disorder (DSPD - which requires a stimulant as treatment).  I hate non-stimulants, and I hate anything other than regular release plain ass Adderall.  Anything else makes me feel disgusting and doesn‚Äôt do anything for my ADHD.  Adderall is smooth and I can focus.  That‚Äôs me, though.  Everyone is completely different and asking this is really just going to give you a gamut of answers, it‚Äôs going to be your body and a bunch of factors specific to you as to how it will work.  It‚Äôs super frustrating that medication results can‚Äôt just be extrapolated.   Some day.
That‚Äôs a dream I‚Äôll dream for now.  Thank you for that good thought.
That‚Äôs pretty funny and I might use it.  Solid.

Haha!  Three weeks is the uncanny valley, isn‚Äôt it?  I had a message from a VIP on 4/6 and I just responded yesterday.  Only because I feel like anything more than 3 weeks, even in COVID times, is too long.  Really had to force myself to compose a robotic, hey how ya doin‚Äô type message that took the entire stupid day because it literally had to be perfect.  God, I just realized I prioritized my entire day yesterday to write that letter.  Gross.  Why?!  I went into this relationship telling myself I was going to be honest and real and no masking.  So why did I feel the need to write a perfect letter?  Cuz he literally melts my brain he‚Äôs so yum.  I know, gross.  I feel like I can‚Äôt explain things in my head and it ties me up when I try to get them onto paper.  I need to stop judging myself so hard.  Thanks for the chat, guys!!!  Lol.
Authoritarian logic, really, I mean...getting closer every day.

That apology - that‚Äôs something you may never get.  That might be the worst part of everything.  When you realize and take in that they‚Äôre really just crap people who won‚Äôt apologize, you are on your way to healing.  Hell, I‚Äôm several years into the process and I STILL want an apology.  It will never happen, and I‚Äôve had to give up wanting one.
Look up executive function-it‚Äôs a thing, not just with autism but also ADHD and other conditions.

That is fantastic advice, and I need to remember that this isn‚Äôt in my control.  I started to run about 6 months ago in a regular routine, but needed full hysterectomy and when gym shut down mid-March, I stopped running.  It took me 20 years to get back into the gym!  I‚Äôm yelling at myself for stopping, but really, I just need to heal (just had surgery 5 days ago) and start up again instead of putting so much emotion into it.  I guess it was helping me with my irritability and outright rage at the world sometimes, to go run hard, but it‚Äôs out of my control right now.  I want to run but I must walk, one day at a time.

Put up boundaries around those soul suckers.  Tell them if they won‚Äôt seek help, you can‚Äôt listen to them more than an hour a week regarding whatever nagging issue they give you.  Or less, just give them less time, but tell them you‚Äôre doing it.  Make it a boundary you stick to so you‚Äôre not constantly hearing the same stories of the same stuck people doing the same shit when you‚Äôve asked them to seek help elsewhere.  It will help keep you sane.  Peace.

There‚Äôs a magnifying glass on all of the broken systems and it‚Äôs disconcerting AF because I‚Äôve been watching it happen for years and just now people are waking up.  I‚Äôve been wondering when the train crash was coming, and for 5 years been waiting - it‚Äôs left the damned station and it‚Äôs chugging down the tracks, now.  We change and people start to participate in reality or we die, it‚Äôs pretty clear!

When you‚Äôre an empath, it‚Äôs really important to learn boundaries so you don‚Äôt end up getting overwhelmed.  Empaths can take on the feelings of others, we feel so deeply.  That‚Äôs crushing, and if you do it too much, it can feel like you‚Äôre drowning in other people‚Äôs feelings.  Without space for your own feelings, you drown.  Put up boundaries and stick to them - stuff like saying no to doing too much, limiting how much news you take in, limiting certain draining people access to you - boundaries will keep you feeling more balanced.  We need empathy in the world, so we need you!  Take care.  And you can, to a small degree, just not give a fuck sometimes.  That‚Äôs perfectly ok!  Get lost in something and forget about things for a minute.  Peace.

It doesn‚Äôt matter.  I feel like you‚Äôre in a stoned panic attack asking this question.  It seriously doesn‚Äôt matter.  Lots of things do not matter if you‚Äôre ‚Äúdoing them correctly‚Äù - there‚Äôs not one way to do most anything, so it‚Äôs fine.  However you do it!  You can always look up how other people do things for tips and see if they work better for you, but I feel like showering is a very personal thing to do and however you wanna is fine.   As long as there is soap and a scrubbin, not seeing any major problems.  Best to ya!

I think you might have it in your head that it‚Äôs your fault and that you don‚Äôt know how to do things - neither of these are true.  There is NO ONE WAY!  You may have been taught that but I promise you it is not true.  You know how to do lots of things that other people don‚Äôt and vice versa - it‚Äôs a thing that JUST IS. There‚Äôs no judgement, it‚Äôs just a fact.  What helps is if you remember that probably no one is watching you do anything going ‚Äúoh my god, Lisa!  Why would you fold that towel that way?!‚Äù  Like my mom used to to that, but she‚Äôs why I have CTPSD.  I used to think I did everything wrong.  That‚Äôs not the problem!  The problem is thinking that there is a right vs. wrong way to do stuff and that your value as a person has anything to do with whether you do something well or not.  My advice is to be open minded and try to learn how other people do things, just by watching and asking questions.  Don‚Äôt judge them or yourself - just watch.  You‚Äôre going to see that people are so different about how they feel about doing things that it doesn‚Äôt really matter in the scheme of life and that your value as a person has nothing to do with any of that.  If you want to do something well, put your mind to it to learn how, mindfully.  Be kind to yourself, is what I‚Äôm saying.  It just works better to stop blaming and shaming yourself for stuff, in general, I think.
If he did that, would he be removed?  Would the powers that be offer us that courtesy?  I‚Äôm losing faith real quick, people.  HELP!

I was waiting for you to write exactly what you did!  ‚ÄúI was really feeling like shit...‚Äù.   Yeah, because you‚Äôre on a stupid sleep schedule-how‚Äôd you manage to go to bed at 2 am every night?  I feel like before 4 am, they‚Äôd have to medically induce sleep.  And that waking at 9 am shit?  Go away ‚Äî DSPDers do not need to be awake in the morning.  I don‚Äôt care when I sleep, functioning in the morning just isn‚Äôt a thing, EVER.   I don‚Äôt care if the sun‚Äôs up and I‚Äôve gotten a million hours of sleep and conditions are perfect for morning and but oh!  A ROUTINE - YOU‚ÄôVE GOT A ROUTINE, YOU SIMPLY MUST FEEL BETTER!- I feel like a giant dog turd warmed in the sun and like my brain will seep out of my ears if I have to be forced to function productively from about 7 am to 11 am.  Can‚Äôt. Do. It.  Feels like drowning or something.  Those hours are evil and I never want to be awake during them.  Once they have a drug that makes me feel not crazy and in a foggy haze during those hours, then my DSPD will be cured.  I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs going to happen, though, because it‚Äôs the mirror of a normal person‚Äôs sleep - they feel like this when they have to function in the dead of night at 4 am.  Normal people don‚Äôt need to function in dead of night, so why should we be expected to do the same?!   I think I just need to move somewhere that people are awake at night more or something - maybe the real cure is a town full of DSPDers where our society functions at night.  As it should be!!!  Yeah, sneaky tests pretending that insomnia help is helpful for DSPD sounds like something evil people would do so they can shame us more when their insomnia cure doesn‚Äôt work.  Shame on them.
She did.  This is well covered territory.

I‚Äôm about to blow your mind with this information then: there are people who have a sleep disorder who literally cannot sleep until about 4 AM, sometimes much later.  It‚Äôs called delayed phase sleep disorder.  I have it and it‚Äôs the worst.  I agree, don‚Äôt mess up your sleep.  But if you‚Äôve never slept before midnight in your life, might check it out.  Circadian rhythm disorder.

I‚Äôm 43, and just last night, immediately was more immediate than usual.  So, yes, absolutely!  All the time.  It‚Äôs a hibernation and a complete block out of stimulation from everything.  My true comfort zone.  Perfection.  The problem is when you spend too much time there.  Just balance trying to become more resilient with hibernation, don‚Äôt do either too much.  You have to grow, so you can‚Äôt crawl into bed every single time you want to-you have to experience life and all of its chaos in order to eventually dampen your visceral experience with life.  Don‚Äôt want to half live.  I‚Äôve done that for years now and I refuse to deal with my anxiety by crawling into bed every time I feel anxiety or really any overwhelming feelings.  I‚Äôd rather deal with the thing and get it over with than let things fester in my anxious mind while I lay in bed ruminating on it.

One goal at a time.  Break it down into its smallest parts and do only those things when you have a choice about how to use your time.  That way, you‚Äôre only focusing on the one thing all the time and even if it feels slow as hell, you‚Äôre doing more via this method than the way you‚Äôre doing it now.   Feels slow.  You have to build up your tolerance to frustration, which sort of paradoxically starts with getting things done.  If you focus on one goal and get it done, this creates a new path in your brain that you can draw on to give you confidence in the future.  Start with a super small goal.  Literally anything. Build from there.
